alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 12:37PM MST until March 23 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy rain and melting snow have lead to fast rising flows in rivers, which will reach critical levels. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Flooding over low-water crossings. Roads are closed and impassable due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Grief Hill Wash, West Clear Creek, Bull Run Creek, Gaddis Wash, Beaver Creek, Chasm Creek, Verde River and Cherry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde and Middle Verde. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 near mile marker 218...and between mile markers 220 and 222. Interstate 17 near mile marker 288. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
